title: Costa Leads California Delegation in Calling for Education Department to Restore Funding for Minority-Serving Institutions

Derek Tran (CA-45), and U.S. Senators Alex Padilla (D-CA) and Adam Schiff (D-CA) led the California Democratic Congressional Delegation in a letter strongly opposing the Department of Education’s decision to rescind $350 million in funding from Minority-Serving Institutions (MSIs).

name: Education Funding
title: Comparing FY 2026 Labor, Health and Human Services, Education Appropriations Bills - EPIC for America
description: For Fiscal Year 2026, the House Labor-HHS-Education bill would spend $184.5 billion and the Senate bill would spend $197 billion, a difference of $13.7 billion or 6.8%. The $13.7 billion spending difference between the House and Senate is caused by divergent policy choices. If Congress intends to spend a 12-figure sum, it should do so with deliberation.
